source.name: Summative Assessment #1

answers.answer: A play is a collection of tasks that are run on a set of hosts.
A module is a reusable block of code that performs a specific action, such as copying a file or restarting a service.
A task is a single unit of work to be performed on a managed host, and it typically uses a module to perform the work.
A playbook is a collection of plays organized in a specific order to achieve a specific goal.
A module is a sequence of Ansible tasks that run in parallel.
A handler is a type of task that is executed only when a play fails.
The inventory is a file that contains a list of control nodes.
A task is a set of instructions that is executed by a playbook.

source.guidance:
- A play is a collection of tasks that are run on a set of hosts.
 - A module is a reusable block of code that performs a specific action, such as copying a file or restarting a service.
 - A task is a single unit of work to be performed on a managed host, and it typically uses a module to perform the work.
 - A playbook is a collection of plays organized in a specific order to achieve a specific goal.
 - A handler is a special type of task that is only executed when a task in the same play notifies it. 
 - The inventory file is used to define the managed nodes (target hosts) and groups that Ansible will operate on.
